results.title: Shepherd dog and his flock
results.brief_description: Shows the day’s activities of two German Shepherd dogs and the shepherd for whom they work. Reveals how both dogs handle the flock of sheep and keep it moving toward pasture. No narration.

results.title: Shepherd's pie and sushi
results.creator_credit: 100 Miles Film Group, ONF | NFB, Craig Anderl, Mieko Ouchi and Jerry Krepakevich
results.brief_description: Mieko Ouchi is an aspiring actress, half Celtic and half Japanese, who is cast in The War Between Us, a film on the World War II internment of 22,000 Japanese-Canadians, in the midst of researching her own documentary about this key episode in her own family’s history. The program investigates questions of personal and cultural identity as Mieko discovers more and more about her past and her heritage as the filming progresses and the complex implications of hers and her family’s struggle to come to terms with their sense of displacement in both Canadian and Japanese society. An autobiographical documentary as well as family chronicle, this documentary also elucidates a strained period in Japanese-Canadian history through the use of archival footage, interviews with the Ouchi family, dramatic re-enactments and excerpts from The War Between Us.

results.title: Sheltered workshops
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, David Bairstow and Kit Guyatt
results.brief_description: Shows how sheltered workshops provide training and employment for variously handicapped people. Discusses the main problems in organising a local centre. Explains the work being done to encourage and assist disabled and handicapped people. About 150,000 Australians of working age are so seriously handicapped, mentally or physically, that they are unable to join the normal workforce. Today more than 5,000 are usefully and gainfully employed in a growing community movement - the sheltered workshop.

results.title: Shelter (USA)
results.brief_description: This film traces man’s growing ability to change the form of materials, and shows how the development of transportation has increased the variety and the supply of raw materials available to man, for building himself shelter from the elements. Examples range from African grass huts and Eskimo igloos to skyscrapers and individual homes in and industrialized country.

results.title: Shellshocked
results.creator_credit: Ramsey Films, Jane Ramsey and Stephen Ramsey
results.brief_description: Four very different Australian veterans of the Vietnam war, all permanently affected by shellshock, return to Vietnam as part of the process of healing the trauma they suffered. This documentary follows the veterans as they travel together, flashing back to their individual war stories which are illustrated with unique home video footage. The high moment of the film occurs when they meet with veterans from the other side: ex Viet Cong guerrillas who, just like the Australian vets, are suffering from post-traumatic stress. A film about redemption that provides some startling insights into the nature of war.

results.title: Shell fishing
results.brief_description: Along the eastern coast of the united States, fishermen gather from the ocean and bays many different types of shellfish - oysters, crabs, clams, lobsters - using lines, traps and nets. Their catches are shipped fresh to many parts of the USA, with the aid of special packing and refrigeration; canned, they are exported all over the world. This film uses dialog recorded among the fishermen in various parts of the east coast of USA, thus emphasizing the rgionals differences in speech
